text: Allan J. Pinkerton (August 25, 1819 – July 1, 1884) was a Scottish–American detective and spy. He was best known for creating the Pinkerton National Detective Agency. He was known for protecting then-President-elect of the United States Abraham Lincoln during the Baltimore Plot (a plan to kill Lincoln in Baltimore, Maryland in 1862). ==References== Category:1819 births Category:1884 deaths Category:Naturalized citizens of the United States Category:Businesspeople from Chicago Category:Spies Category:Burials at Graceland Cemetery Category:American autobiographers Category:American abolitionists
title: Allan Pinkerton
